Docs.summary: Represents an expression used as a method invoke parameter along with a reference direction indicator.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeDirectionExpression> can represent a parameter passed to a method and the reference direction of the parameter.
The <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeDirectionExpression.Expression%2A> property indicates the expression to qualify with a direction. The <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeDirectionExpression.Direction%2A> property indicates the direction of the parameter using one of the <xref:System.CodeDom.FieldDirection> enumeration values.
> [!NOTE] > <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeDirectionExpression> is intended to be used as a method invoke parameter, and should not be used when declaring methods.
## Examples The following example demonstrates use of a <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeDirectionExpression> to specify a field direction modifier for an expression to pass as a method parameter.
